content.title: Loop Quantum Gravity: Discrete Spacetime at the Planck Scale
content.abstract: Loop Quantum Gravity (LQG) is a non-perturbative, background-independent approach to quantum gravity that predicts spacetime geometry is quantized at the Planck scale. Area and volume operators have discrete spectra with minimum eigenvalues related to ℓ_P², providing one of the most concrete realizations of Planck-scale physics.
content.statement: Loop Quantum Gravity: Discrete Spacetime at the Planck Scale is a fundamental concept in Natural-Sciences Physics Quantum-Mechanics Planck-Units that provides essential knowledge for understanding related topics and clinical/practical applications.

spin_networks.definition: Graph with edges labeled by SU(2) spins (j = 0, 1/2, 1, ...) and vertices by intertwiners
spin_networks.interpretation: Quantum state of spatial geometry; edges represent quanta of area
spin_networks.history: Introduced by Penrose (1971), adopted in LQG by Rovelli & Smolin (1995)

spin_foams.definition: 2-complexes with faces labeled by spins, providing histories of spin networks
spin_foams.interpretation: Path integral for LQG; spacetime histories between initial and final spin networks
spin_foams.models: Barrett-Crane, EPRL/FK, and other specific spin foam models

holonomy.definition: Parallel transport of connection around a loop: h_γ = P exp(∮ A)
holonomy.interpretation: Fundamental variable in LQG; well-defined on discontinuous connections

immirzi_parameter.definition: Free parameter in Ashtekar-Barbero connection formulation
immirzi_parameter.significance: Sets the area gap: A_min ~ γℓ_P²

physical_predictions.status: Mathematical result; no direct experimental test

physical_predictions.property: Volume operator at graph vertices has discrete eigenvalues
physical_predictions.gap: V_min ~ ℓ_P³ (roughly, actual formula more complex)
physical_predictions.status: Mathematical result; harder to compute than area

physical_predictions.result: S_BH = A/(4ℓ_P²) recovered with correct coefficient
physical_predictions.method: Counting spin network states piercing horizon

physical_predictions.description: Loop quantum cosmology replaces Big Bang singularity with bounce
physical_predictions.mechanism: Quantum geometry repulsion at Planck density
physical_predictions.status: Theoretical; may leave imprints in CMB

physical_predictions.description: Discrete geometry may affect photon propagation
physical_predictions.constraint: Fermi LAT gamma-ray observations constrain effects
physical_predictions.status: Not observed; LQG effects may be too small

vs_string_theory.strings: Perturbative; requires extra dimensions; predicts continuous spacetime with minimum length
vs_string_theory.lqg: Non-perturbative; works in 4D; predicts discrete geometry
vs_string_theory.common: Both predict Planck-scale modifications to spacetime

vs_causal_sets.causal_sets: Discrete spacetime assumed from start; random sprinkling of points
vs_causal_sets.lqg: Discreteness emerges from quantization; structured spin networks

vs_asymptotic_safety.asymptotic_safety: Gravity is well-behaved at high energies; no discreteness required
vs_asymptotic_safety.relation: Possibly compatible or describing different regimes

Missing the role of Immirzi parameter γ
